info.description: API for managing scheduled tasks and task groups
info.title: Cron Observer API

post.description: Append a log entry to an execution by execution UUID

patch.description: Update the status of an execution (SUCCESS, FAILED, RUNNING)

get.description: Retrieve a list of all projects

post.description: Create a new project with auto-generated UUID and API key

get.description: Retrieve all task groups belonging to a project

post.description: Create a new task group in a project

get.description: Retrieve a task group by its UUID

post.description: Manually start all tasks in a task group
Manually stop all tasks in a task group

get.description: Retrieve all tasks belonging to a task group
Retrieve all tasks belonging to a project

post.description: Create a new scheduled task in a project

get.description: Retrieve all executions for a specific task filtered by date

parameters.description: Filter by date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Returns executions for that date only
parameters.name: date

patch.description: Update a task's status (ACTIVE or DISABLED) and update scheduler accordingly

models.Execution.description: Execution represents a task execution record

models.Project.description: Project represents a project entity that contains tasks

models.ProjectUser.description: ProjectUser represents a user associated with a project

cron_expression.description: If provided, TimeRange and DaysOfWeek are ignored

days_of_week.description: Used only if CronExpression is not provided

time_range.description: Used only if CronExpression is not provided

models.Task.description: Task represents a scheduled task entity

trigger_config.description: Deprecated: Tasks now use project's execution_endpoint

models.TaskGroup.description: TaskGroup represents a group of tasks that can be controlled together

description.example: Tasks that run in the morning

frequency.description: Frequency with value and unit (e.g., {value: 15, unit: "m"})
